summary: The Reforming Education for Veterans Act (HR 1527) amends Title 38 of the United States Code, focusing on educational assistance for veterans. It modifies provisions related to absences from education due to service, allowing for withdrawal, leave of absence, or agreements to complete courses. It also changes Department of Veterans Affairs compliance surveys for educational institutions and requires the Secretary to notify school certifying officials of handbook updates. The bill aims to improve the administration of educational benefits for veterans.
